eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.highlighting

Class SourceCodeHtmlFormatter

  • java.lang.Object
    • eu.cqse.check.framework.scanner.highlighting.SourceCodeHtmlFormatter

  • public class SourceCodeHtmlFormatter
extends java.lang.Object
    Helper class for formatting source code as HTML. This class is intended to be customized by subclassing, although it can also be used as is.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected HTMLWriter writer
      The writer for output.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      SourceCodeHtmlFormatter()

      • formatSourceCode

        public void formatSourceCode(java.lang.String content,
                             ELanguage language,
                             java.util.List<Region> disabledRegions,
                             HTMLWriter writer)
        Formats the source code (given as token stream) using the writer.
        Parameters:
        disabledRegions - list of regions (begin and end offset) in the text that are displayed as disabled. The regions may not overlap and must be sorted by start position.

      • format

        protected void format()
        Performs the actual formatting.

      • insertLineNumberSpacer

        protected void insertLineNumberSpacer(int lineNumber)
        Template method for inserting HTML between the line number and the line content.
        Parameters:
        lineNumber - the number of this line, if required by subclasses.

      • lineNumberStyleFor

        protected CSSDeclarationBlock lineNumberStyleFor(int lineNumber)
        Allows deriving classes to adapt the line number style according to the line number

      • determineCSS

        Returns the CSS class to be used for a token (or null).

      • init

        protected void init()
        Lazy initialization. We do not initialize styles in the constructor, as this might lead to cases where this constructor calls overridden methods.

      • getDisabledStyle

        protected ImmutablePair<java.awt.Color,java.lang.Integer> getDisabledStyle()
        Returns the style pair to be used for disabled code.

      • createBaseStyle

        protected CSSDeclarationBlock createBaseStyle()
        Creates the base style all other styles inherit from.

      • createLineStyle

        protected CSSDeclarationBlock createLineStyle(CSSDeclarationBlock baseStyle)
        Creates the style used for the div element enclosing the line.

      • createEvenLineStyle

        protected CSSDeclarationBlock createEvenLineStyle(CSSDeclarationBlock baseStyle)
        Creates the style used for the div element enclosing even lines. Default implementation uses createLineStyle(CSSDeclarationBlock).

      • createOddLineStyle

        protected CSSDeclarationBlock createOddLineStyle(CSSDeclarationBlock baseStyle)
        Creates the style used for the div element enclosing odd lines. Default implementation uses createLineStyle(CSSDeclarationBlock).

      • createLineNumberStyle

        protected CSSDeclarationBlock createLineNumberStyle(CSSDeclarationBlock baseStyle)
        Creates the style used for the line number.
